page.title: 05PIREHILL LANE
page.content: Pirehill Lane is about 3 km. long, a steady climb from North to South. The first half has houses (1930-1960's) and pavements then it changes to a farm lane. There are 35 detached houses, 46 semi-detached, 15 bungalows and the "Bonnie Gem" public house. In the small shopping precinct there are 8 shops. One is empty but the others are:General Store, Newsagents, Ladies' Hairdresser, Carpet shop, Launderette, Pet Fish store and the National Farmers' Union Offices for the Eccleshall and Stone Branch. The eastern side of the road borders a Warehousing area. On the corner of Wood Lane is a huge oak tree. Its circumference is 3.06 m. Many pupils from Pirehill First and Walton Priory Middle Schools live on or off Pirehill Lane.
